result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason A Rasberry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 35 days were granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform agent of all prescriptions.

No Violent Contact with the victim. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed.  Case 14CM1625 was dismissed and read in.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight Time. LAST 30 Days are STAYED for 60 days compliance with Day Report Center. Good time is not allowed on DRC. If defendant successfully completes the Day Report Center, the 30 days of Stayed Jail will be permanently stayed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jason A Rasberry in court, in custody, with Attorney Mark A. Pecora.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentence.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1 & 2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1 & 2.  Count #3 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Pecora makes statements regarding sentencing.   Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS  (35 Days credit, if revoked)

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No violent contact with:  victim
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  60 Days straight time  = LAST 30 DAYS STAYED for 60 Days Day Report Center.  Good time not allowed on DRC.  If Defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 30 Days stayed will be permanently stayed.

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant


COUNT #2:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No violent contact with:  victim

COSTS:  $343.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)
